text:
I was diagnosed recently (in my early 40s!), and as someone who can’t take stimulants, medication has been challenging. I do find that if I am able to block off chunks of time to focus on things (be it writing or a presentation or whatever), I am much more productive.

As far as the perfectionist thing. . . I definitely feel that! I’ve really tried to stick with write it all - everything - then delete 1/3 - 1/2 of it. Then start editing for grammar, sentence structure, etc. It allows me to be more “creative” to write in what I term “brain dump” w/o worrying about all the technical points, but then when I go back in to edit, I don’t usually have to worry about CONTENT, just the fact that I’ve rewritten the same sentence 34 times in the last hour. :wink:

I was diagnosed recently (in my early 40s!), and as someone who can’t take stimulants, medication has been challenging. I do find that if I am able to block off chunks of time to focus on things (be it writing or a presentation or whatever), I am much more productive.

As far as the perfectionist thing. . . I definitely feel that! I’ve really tried to stick with write it all - everything - then delete 1/3 - 1/2 of it. Then start editing for grammar, sentence structure, etc. It allows me to be more “creative” to write in what I term “brain dump” w/o worrying about all the technical points, but then when I go back in to edit, I don’t usually have to worry about CONTENT, just the fact that I’ve rewritten the same sentence 34 times in the last hour.
